abstract: Researchers report in journal Nature Biotechnology that first release into environment of mosquitoes engineered to pass a lethal gene to their offspring, killing them before they reach adulthood, appears to be successful; results could herald age in which genetically modified insects will be used to help control agricultural pests and insect-borne diseases like dengue fever and malaria.
snippet: Researchers have bred mosquitoes engineered to pass a lethal gene to their offspring, killing them before they reach adulthood.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have bred mosquitoes engineered to pass a lethal gene to their offspring, killing them before they reach adulthood.

headline.main: Concerns Are Raised About Genetically Engineered Mosquitoes
headline.print_headline: Mosquito Bred to Fight Dengue Fever Shows Promise in a Field Test
headline.seo: Concerns Raised about Genetically Engineered Mosquitoes
